other_tests.findings: QST was altered for all tested modalities; patients were unable to perceive noxious thermal stimuli and innocuous warm stimuli.
CVR showed abnormalities including 30/15 ratio and blood pressure response to standing, indicating sympathetic and parasympathetic system impairment.
Dynamic sweat test showed a severe reduction of sweat production in both upper and lower limbs.
Skin biopsy revealed a lack of myelinated and unmyelinated somatic and autonomic nerve fibers; loss of Meissner corpuscles and epidermal nerve fibers in both proximal and distal sites.
